intro: Hydrocotyle moschata, commonly known as sweet buttercup, is a flowering plant native to wetland areas in North America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, white flowers with five petals, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Hydrocotyle moschata is also known for its aromatic foliage, which emits a mild, sweet scent.
